newsitem.title: USA: Meriden, Conn., seeks to sell real estate - paper.
newsitem.headline: Meriden, Conn., seeks to sell real estate - paper.

text.p: Meriden, Conn., seeking to boost tax revenues, hopes to sell around 40 of the 71 real estate properties that it owns, the Hartford Courant said on Tuesday.

The city, which acquired the real estate over a number of years for various reasons, including abandonment and foreclosures, estimates that it is worth several hundred thousand dollars, the paper quoted the city manager as saying.
On Wednesday, Meriden is expected to allocate $10,000 from the contingency budget for appraisals.

Meriden plans to keep 31 of its properties for a variety of reasons, including possible parks and libraries. The city will seek requests from interested buyers for 16 properties, including vacant lots and a three-family house.
Another 20 sites will be sold through a real estate broker, while a four abandoned properties are expected to revert to the adjacent property owners.
